original: Bäckman, Elon Conrad, köpman, Göteborg, f. 2/6/00 av Erik Conrad B. o. Emilia Pettersson. G. 45 m. Margit Östergren. — Stud. v. Eskilstuna tekn. sk. 15-16, merkant. utb. v. Hermods korresp :inst. Kont. v. Munktelis Mek. Verkst. A-B i Eskilstuna 15-21, avd:-chef f. planeringen v. Nydqvist & Holm A-B, Eskilstuna-Verken, 21-23, ink:chef där 23-25, kamr. o. försäljn:-chief i jiärnigrossh : firman Knut W. Are-skogh i Eskilstuna (repr. f. Avesta Jernverk, A-B Bofors o. A-B Axel Christiernsson) 25-45, egen firma i Gbg sed. 45. Sekr. i sekt. f. fri idr., fiolb., biandy o. skidor i GUIF i Eskils-tunia 17-24i, s€kt. f. fri idr. o. bandy 28-32, sekr. i Södermani. idr:förb. 25-27, v. sekr. 28 o. 39-45, styr :led. i Sv:es GUIF sekt. f. gymn. o. idr. 24-30, stift, av Södermani. bandyförb. 29, dess sekr. o. kassör 29-33, rev. i Eskilstuna tenniskl. 30-32, sekr. 33-36, ordf. i arb:-utsk. 35, sekr. 39-41, ordf. 42-45, init:-tag. t. Södermani. idr :förb. tennissekt. i Eskilstuna 38, ordf. 38-45, sekr. i fören. Eskilstuna idr :hall u. p. a. 38-45, omb :man f. riksskidmarschen i Södermani. 42-45, instruktör i civ:försv. 40-45. Bandy- o. fotb:domare 19-25, domare i fri idr. 19-44, dito i tennis 32-45. Har hemf. flera segrar i fotb., bandy, löpn., cykel o. tennis. Med-arb. i Sörmiandsposten und. sign. Con Brio, i GUIF medl :blad Lysmasken 20-29, red. 29-32. Riksidr :förb. för-tj :t. i guld.
translated: Bäckman, Elon Conrad, merchant, Gothenburg, b. June 2nd, 1900 to Erik Conrad B. and Emilia Pettersson. Married in 1945 to Margit Östergren. Studied at Eskilstuna Technical School from 1915 to 1916, and received commercial education from Hermods Correspondence Institute. Worked at Munktelis Mechanical Works AB in Eskilstuna from 1915 to 1921, became department manager for planning at Nydqvist & Holm AB, Eskilstuna-Verken from 1921 to 1923, then head of purchase from 1923 to 1925. Became a trade and sales manager for iron wholesale firm Knut W. Areskogh in Eskilstuna, representing Avesta Jernverk AB, AB Bofors, and AB Axel Christiernsson from 1925 to 1945. Started his own company in Gothenburg in 1945. Served as secretary for the section for free sports, ice hockey, bandy and skiing at GUIF in Eskilstuna from 1917 to 1924. Served as secretary for the section for free sports and bandy from 1928 to 1932, and as secretary and vice-secretary for Södermani. Idrarförbund from 1925 to 1927, and from 1928 to 1945 respectivelty. Also served as a board member for the Swedish GUIF section for gymnastics and sports from 1924 to 1930, and for the Södermani. Bandy Association in 1929, as well as its secretary and treasurer from 1929 to 1933. Served as auditor for the Eskilstuna Tennis Club from 1930 to 1932, before becoming its secretary from 1933 to 1936, and then chairman from 1938 to 1945. Initiated the Södermani. Idrarforbund tennis section in Eskilstuna in 1938, and served as chairman from 1938 to 1945. Also served as secretary for Eskilstuna Sports Hall Association from 1938 to 1945, and as an official for the national ski march in Södermani. from 1942 to 1945. Instructed in civil defense from 1940 to 1945. Was a bandy and football referee from 1919 to 1925, a referee in free sports from 1919 to 1944, and a tennis referee from 1932 to 1945. Won several victories in football, bandy, running, cycling, and tennis. Was a collaborator for Sörmiandsposten under the pseudonym Con Brio, and was a member and editor of Lysmasken from 1920 to 1929. Received gold from the National Sports Federation.

awards.name: Gold from the National Sports Federation
